medicines.name: Paracetamol
medicines.uses: Used to treat mild to moderate pain and reduce fever. Effective for headaches, muscle aches, arthritis, backache, toothaches, colds, and fevers.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 500-1000mg every 4-6 hours. Maximum 4000mg per day. Children: 10-15mg/kg every 4-6 hours.

medicines.name: Ibuprofen
medicines.uses: Anti-inflammatory drug used to reduce fever and treat pain or inflammation caused by conditions like headache, toothache, back pain, arthritis, menstrual cramps, or minor injury.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 200-400mg every 4-6 hours. Maximum 1200mg per day. Take with food to reduce stomach irritation.

medicines.name: Aspirin
medicines.uses: Used to reduce pain, fever, or inflammation. Also used in low doses to prevent heart attacks and strokes in high-risk patients.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 325-650mg every 4 hours for pain. Low dose: 75-100mg daily for heart protection. Take with food.

medicines.name: Diclofenac
medicines.uses: NSAID used to treat pain and inflammation in conditions like arthritis, muscle strains, dental pain, and post-operative pain.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 25-50mg 2-3 times daily with food. Maximum 150mg per day. Avoid in elderly and those with heart conditions.

medicines.name: Tramadol
medicines.uses: Opioid pain medication used to treat moderate to severe pain. Often prescribed after surgery or for chronic pain conditions.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 50-100mg every 4-6 hours as needed. Maximum 400mg per day. Start with lowest effective dose.

medicines.name: Nimesulide
medicines.uses: NSAID with anti-inflammatory and fever-reducing properties. Used for acute pain, dental pain, and inflammatory conditions.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 100mg twice daily after meals. Not recommended for children under 12 years. Maximum 15 days continuous use.

medicines.name: Amoxicillin
medicines.uses: Broad-spectrum antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections including respiratory tract infections, urinary tract infections, skin infections, and dental infections.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 250-500mg every 8 hours or 500-875mg every 12 hours. Children: 20-40mg/kg/day divided into 3 doses. Complete full course.

medicines.name: Azithromycin
medicines.uses: Macrolide antibiotic used to treat respiratory infections, skin infections, ear infections, and sexually transmitted diseases. Often used when penicillin allergies exist.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 500mg on day 1, then 250mg daily for 4 days. Or 500mg daily for 3 days. Take on empty stomach.

medicines.name: Ciprofloxacin
medicines.uses: Fluoroquinolone antibiotic used to treat urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, skin infections, and gastrointestinal infections.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 250-750mg every 12 hours. Take with plenty of water. Avoid dairy products and antacids within 2 hours.

medicines.name: Doxycycline
medicines.uses: Tetracycline antibiotic used for respiratory infections, acne, malaria prevention, and tick-borne diseases. Also used for certain sexually transmitted infections.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 100mg twice daily or 200mg once daily. Take with food and plenty of water. Avoid lying down for 30 minutes after taking.

medicines.name: Cephalexin
medicines.uses: First-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat skin infections, respiratory tract infections, urinary tract infections, and bone infections.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 250-500mg every 6 hours. Children: 25-50mg/kg/day divided into 4 doses. Take with or without food.

medicines.name: Clindamycin
medicines.uses: Lincosamide antibiotic used for serious infections caused by anaerobic bacteria, including bone infections, dental infections, and skin infections.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 150-300mg every 6 hours. Severe infections: 300-450mg every 6 hours. Take with full glass of water.

medicines.name: Cetirizine
medicines.uses: Antihistamine used to treat allergic rhinitis, hay fever, urticaria (hives), and other allergic reactions. Helps with sneezing, runny nose, and itchy eyes.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 10mg once daily. Children 6-12 years: 5-10mg once daily. Children 2-6 years: 2.5-5mg once daily.

medicines.name: Phenylephrine + Paracetamol
medicines.uses: Combination medicine for cold and flu symptoms. Phenylephrine is a decongestant that relieves nasal congestion, while paracetamol reduces fever and pain.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 1-2 tablets every 4-6 hours. Maximum 8 tablets per day. Do not exceed recommended dose.

medicines.name: Dextromethorphan
medicines.uses: Cough suppressant used to treat dry, non-productive cough. Helps reduce the urge to cough by acting on the cough center in the brain.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 15-30mg every 4-8 hours. Children 6-12 years: 7.5-15mg every 4-8 hours. Maximum 120mg per day.

medicines.name: Loratadine
medicines.uses: Non-sedating antihistamine used to treat seasonal allergies, hay fever, and chronic urticaria. Does not cause drowsiness like older antihistamines.
medicines.dosage: Adults and children over 6 years: 10mg once daily. Children 2-5 years: 5mg once daily. Take on empty stomach.

medicines.name: Guaifenesin
medicines.uses: Expectorant that helps loosen and thin mucus in the airways, making it easier to cough up. Used for productive coughs with thick mucus.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 200-400mg every 4 hours. Children 6-12 years: 100-200mg every 4 hours. Drink plenty of fluids.

medicines.name: Pseudoephedrine
medicines.uses: Nasal decongestant used to relieve stuffy nose and sinus congestion caused by colds, allergies, or sinus infections.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 60mg every 4-6 hours or 120mg every 12 hours. Maximum 240mg per day. Take with food if stomach upset occurs.

medicines.name: Omeprazole
medicines.uses: Proton pump inhibitor used to treat gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), peptic ulcers, and Zollinger-Ellison syndrome. Reduces stomach acid production.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 20-40mg once daily before breakfast. For ulcers: 20mg daily for 4-8 weeks. Take on empty stomach.

medicines.name: Domperidone
medicines.uses: Anti-nausea medication used to treat nausea, vomiting, and gastroparesis. Also helps with gastric motility disorders and bloating.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 10mg 3-4 times daily before meals. Children: 0.25mg/kg 3-4 times daily. Take 15-30 minutes before meals.

medicines.name: Loperamide
medicines.uses: Anti-diarrheal medication used to treat acute and chronic diarrhea. Slows down gut movement and reduces the frequency of bowel movements.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 4mg initially, then 2mg after each loose stool. Maximum 16mg per day. Children: consult doctor for dosing.

medicines.name: Ranitidine
medicines.uses: H2 receptor antagonist used to treat peptic ulcers, GERD, and conditions where stomach produces too much acid. Reduces acid production.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 150mg twice daily or 300mg at bedtime. For ulcers: 150mg twice daily for 4-8 weeks. Take with or without food.

medicines.name: Ondansetron
medicines.uses: Anti-nausea medication used to prevent nausea and vomiting caused by chemotherapy, radiation therapy, or surgery. Also used for severe morning sickness.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 4-8mg every 8 hours as needed. For chemotherapy: 8mg before treatment, then 8mg every 12 hours. Take with or without food.

medicines.name: Simethicone
medicines.uses: Anti-foaming agent used to relieve gas, bloating, and abdominal discomfort. Helps break up gas bubbles in the digestive tract.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 40-125mg after meals and at bedtime as needed. Maximum 500mg per day. Can be taken with food.

medicines.name: Vitamin D3
medicines.uses: Essential vitamin for bone health, immune function, and calcium absorption. Used to treat and prevent vitamin D deficiency, osteoporosis, and rickets.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 1000-4000 IU daily. Children: 400-1000 IU daily. Take with fat-containing meal for better absorption.

medicines.name: Multivitamin
medicines.uses: Comprehensive supplement containing essential vitamins and minerals. Used to prevent nutritional deficiencies and support overall health and energy levels.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 1 tablet daily with breakfast. Children: As per pediatric formulation. Take with food to reduce stomach upset.

medicines.name: Iron + Folic Acid
medicines.uses: Used to treat and prevent iron deficiency anemia and folate deficiency. Essential during pregnancy, menstruation, and for vegetarians.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 1 tablet daily on empty stomach. Pregnant women: As prescribed by doctor. Take with vitamin C for better absorption.

medicines.name: Vitamin B12
medicines.uses: Essential for nerve function, red blood cell formation, and DNA synthesis. Used to treat B12 deficiency, pernicious anemia, and neurological disorders.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 1000-2000 mcg daily or weekly injections for severe deficiency. Sublingual tablets: 1000 mcg daily.

medicines.name: Calcium Carbonate
medicines.uses: Calcium supplement used to prevent and treat calcium deficiency, osteoporosis, and bone disorders. Also used as antacid for heartburn.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 500-1200mg daily in divided doses with meals. Take with vitamin D for better absorption. Avoid with iron supplements.

medicines.name: Omega-3 Fatty Acids
medicines.uses: Essential fatty acids for heart health, brain function, and inflammation reduction. Used to lower triglycerides and support cardiovascular health.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 1000-2000mg daily with meals. For high triglycerides: 2000-4000mg daily as prescribed by doctor.

medicines.name: Atorvastatin
medicines.uses: Statin medication used to lower cholesterol and triglyceride levels. Helps prevent heart disease, stroke, and other cardiovascular complications.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 10-80mg once daily in the evening. Start with 10-20mg and adjust based on cholesterol levels. Take with or without food.

medicines.name: Metoprolol
medicines.uses: Beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure, chest pain (angina), and heart failure. Also used after heart attacks to improve survival.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 25-100mg twice daily. Extended-release: 25-200mg once daily. Take with food. Do not stop suddenly.

medicines.name: Clopidogrel
medicines.uses: Antiplatelet medication used to prevent blood clots in patients with heart disease, stroke, or peripheral artery disease. Reduces risk of heart attack and stroke.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 75mg once daily with or without food. Loading dose: 300-600mg for acute conditions. Take at the same time daily.

medicines.name: Digoxin
medicines.uses: Cardiac glycoside used to treat heart failure and atrial fibrillation. Helps the heart beat stronger and more regularly.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 0.125-0.25mg daily. Elderly: 0.125mg daily. Requires regular blood level monitoring. Take at same time daily.

medicines.name: Isosorbide Mononitrate
medicines.uses: Nitrate medication used to prevent chest pain (angina) in people with coronary artery disease. Helps relax and widen blood vessels.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 20mg twice daily with 7-hour gap between doses. Extended-release: 30-120mg once daily in morning.

medicines.name: Warfarin
medicines.uses: Anticoagulant (blood thinner) used to prevent blood clots in conditions like atrial fibrillation, deep vein thrombosis, and pulmonary embolism.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 2-10mg daily based on INR levels. Requires regular blood monitoring. Take at same time daily, usually evening.

medicines.name: Metformin
medicines.uses: First-line medication for type 2 diabetes. Helps control blood sugar by reducing glucose production in the liver and improving insulin sensitivity.
medicines.dosage: Adults: Start with 500mg twice daily with meals. Can increase to 1000mg twice daily. Extended-release: 500-2000mg once daily.

medicines.name: Glimepiride
medicines.uses: Sulfonylurea medication used to treat type 2 diabetes. Stimulates the pancreas to produce more insulin and helps cells use glucose more effectively.
medicines.dosage: Adults: Start with 1-2mg once daily with breakfast. Can increase to 4-8mg daily. Monitor blood sugar regularly.

medicines.name: Regular Insulin
medicines.uses: Short-acting insulin used to control blood sugar in type 1 and type 2 diabetes. Administered before meals to manage post-meal glucose spikes.
medicines.dosage: Individualized based on blood sugar levels. Typically 0.5-1 unit per kg body weight daily. Inject 30 minutes before meals.

medicines.name: Sitagliptin
medicines.uses: DPP-4 inhibitor used to treat type 2 diabetes. Helps increase insulin production and decrease glucose production by the liver.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 100mg once daily with or without food. Reduce dose in kidney disease. Can be combined with other diabetes medications.

medicines.name: Pioglitazone
medicines.uses: Thiazolidinedione used to treat type 2 diabetes. Improves insulin sensitivity and helps cells use glucose more effectively.
medicines.dosage: Adults: Start with 15-30mg once daily. Can increase to 45mg daily. Take with or without food. Monitor liver function.

medicines.name: Gliclazide
medicines.uses: Sulfonylurea medication for type 2 diabetes. Stimulates insulin release from pancreas and improves glucose utilization by tissues.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 40-80mg once or twice daily with meals. Modified-release: 30-120mg once daily. Monitor for hypoglycemia.

medicines.name: Amlodipine
medicines.uses: Calcium channel blocker used to treat high blood pressure and chest pain (angina). Relaxes blood vessels and improves blood flow.
medicines.dosage: Adults: Start with 2.5-5mg once daily. Can increase to 10mg daily. Take at the same time each day, with or without food.

medicines.name: Lisinopril
medicines.uses: ACE inhibitor used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure. Also used after heart attacks to improve survival and prevent kidney problems in diabetics.
medicines.dosage: Adults: Start with 5-10mg once daily. Can increase to 20-40mg daily. Take at the same time daily, with or without food.

medicines.name: Losartan
medicines.uses: ARB (Angiotensin Receptor Blocker) used to treat high blood pressure and protect kidneys in diabetic patients. Also used for heart failure.
medicines.dosage: Adults: Start with 25-50mg once daily. Can increase to 100mg daily. Take with or without food at the same time daily.

medicines.name: Hydrochlorothiazide
medicines.uses: Thiazide diuretic used to treat high blood pressure and fluid retention. Helps kidneys remove excess water and salt from the body.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 12.5-50mg once daily in the morning. Take with food to reduce stomach upset. Monitor electrolyte levels.

medicines.name: Atenolol
medicines.uses: Beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure, chest pain, and prevent heart attacks. Slows heart rate and reduces blood pressure.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 25-100mg once daily. Can be taken with or without food. Do not stop suddenly - taper dose gradually.

medicines.name: Telmisartan
medicines.uses: ARB used to treat high blood pressure and reduce cardiovascular risk. Also provides kidney protection in diabetic patients.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 20-80mg once daily. Can be taken with or without food. Usually taken in the morning at the same time daily.

medicines.name: Sertraline
medicines.uses: SSRI antidepressant used to treat depression, anxiety disorders, panic disorder, PTSD, and OCD. Helps balance serotonin levels in the brain.
medicines.dosage: Adults: Start with 25-50mg daily, can increase to 200mg daily. Take with food to reduce nausea. May take 4-6 weeks to show full effect.

medicines.name: Alprazolam
medicines.uses: Benzodiazepine used for short-term treatment of anxiety disorders and panic attacks. Provides rapid relief of anxiety symptoms.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 0.25-0.5mg 2-3 times daily. Maximum 4mg daily. Start with lowest dose. Avoid alcohol. Can be habit-forming.

medicines.name: Escitalopram
medicines.uses: SSRI antidepressant used to treat major depressive disorder and generalized anxiety disorder. More selective than other SSRIs.
medicines.dosage: Adults: Start with 10mg daily, can increase to 20mg daily. Take in morning or evening consistently. Monitor for suicidal thoughts initially.

medicines.name: Lorazepam
medicines.uses: Benzodiazepine used for anxiety disorders, insomnia, and as pre-medication before medical procedures. Also used for seizure control.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 1-4mg daily in divided doses. For sleep: 2-4mg at bedtime. Elderly: Start with 0.5mg. Use for shortest duration possible.

medicines.name: Tretinoin
medicines.uses: Topical retinoid used to treat acne, reduce fine wrinkles, and improve skin texture. Also used for certain skin conditions like keratosis.
medicines.dosage: Apply thin layer to affected area once daily at bedtime. Start with lower concentration. Use sunscreen during day. Avoid eyes and lips.

medicines.name: Hydrocortisone
medicines.uses: Mild topical corticosteroid used to treat skin inflammation, eczema, dermatitis, insect bites, and minor skin irritations.
medicines.dosage: Apply thin layer to affected area 2-4 times daily. Do not use on face for more than 5 days. Avoid prolonged use.

medicines.name: Clotrimazole
medicines.uses: Antifungal medication used to treat fungal skin infections like athlete's foot, jock itch, ringworm, and yeast infections.
medicines.dosage: Apply to affected area twice daily for 2-4 weeks. Continue for 1 week after symptoms clear. Keep area clean and dry.

medicines.name: Benzoyl Peroxide
medicines.uses: Topical antibacterial agent used to treat acne. Kills acne-causing bacteria and helps unclog pores. Available in various strengths.
medicines.dosage: Apply thin layer to affected area once daily, gradually increase to twice daily. Start with 2.5% strength. May cause dryness initially.

medicines.name: Combined Oral Contraceptive
medicines.uses: Birth control pill containing estrogen and progestin. Also used to regulate menstrual cycles, reduce menstrual cramps, and treat acne.
medicines.dosage: Take 1 tablet daily at the same time for 21 days, then 7-day break. Start on first day of menstrual cycle or as directed.

medicines.name: Mefenamic Acid
medicines.uses: NSAID used to treat menstrual pain, heavy menstrual bleeding, and other types of pain and inflammation. Particularly effective for period pain.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 250-500mg 3 times daily with food. For menstrual pain: start at first sign of bleeding. Maximum 7 days continuous use.

medicines.name: Folic Acid
medicines.uses: B-vitamin essential for DNA synthesis and red blood cell formation. Crucial during pregnancy to prevent neural tube defects in developing baby.
medicines.dosage: Adults: 400-800 mcg daily. Pregnancy: 400-600 mcg daily. High-risk pregnancy: 5mg daily. Take before conception and during pregnancy.
